@realmoney Apr 09, 2020 | 03:52 PM EDT DOUG KASS The Bottom Line * We are all "Japan" now * At 2800, the S&P has hit my "fair market value" * I am back to market neutral -- having sold all of my Index longs * I have no plans to sell my individual stocks as many are undervalued

and trade at a 2400 S&P equivalent (compared to 2800 today) Near term (and with a strong assist from the Fed) the markets are now overbought. Moreover, the S&P has hit my 2800 "fair market value." My calculus is based on 18x S&P 2022 EPS e (essentially the new S&P "earnings

power") of approximately $155/share. But that doesnt mean the markets can't grow more overbought and trade above my intrinsic value -- it happens all the time. And I wouldn't be surprised if it happened in the next few weeks. Over the next few months the downside appears to be

limited by the scope and size of the Fed's bazooka and the upside is likely limited by the magnitude of the necessary financial relief packages and the massive rise in the U.S. debt load that will, in the fullness of time, adversely impact economic growth. As I have written in

recent years in my Diary, it takes more and more stimulus (and associated debt that accompanies that jump start) to deliver a unit of production. Intermediate term and on a normalization of business activity we can go higher because there is no alternative with short-term notes

effectively at zero. While the role of government intervention is unprecedented in scope, a "TINA RIPPER" is not out of the question some time later in the year - in which stocks briefly trade above my intrinsic value guesstimate of 2800. Finally, while I sold out all of my long

Index positions today, put some defined risk out of the money puts $SPY and taken on some shorts (including ($CAT) ) -- I have not disturbed my individual long positions which, in many cases, are trading at 2400 S&P equivalent prices (e,g., banks and selected bottom up analyzed
equities). @jimcramer @tomkeene @SquawkCNBC @cnbcfastmoney @realdonaldtrump @lizclaman @RiskReversal @guyadami @carlquintanilla @saraeisen @SullyCNBC @bobpisani
